name: Student's Butter Chicken
description:
A classic dish for a hungry student, looking for an easy and high protein dinner.

1. Fry your Chicken Breast in a large pan until thoroughly cooked through.
2. Add your Butter Chicken sauce and heat for approximately 5 minutes.

name: Spaghetti Bolognese
description:
Everyone's favourite Spaghetti Bolognese
2 tbsp olive oil
500g beef mince
1 onion, diced
2 garlic cloves, chopped
1 x 400g tin chopped tomatoes
400ml/14fl oz stock (made from stock cube. Ideally beef, but any will do)
400g/14oz dried spaghetti
salt and pepper

name: Batman breakfast
description: BREAKFAST:  Oatmeal, a banana, two boiled eggs, orange juice or green tea.

name: Teriyaki Chicken
description: Love it Love it Love itLove itLove itLove it

name: Chicken fried rice
description:
1. Boil 300G of rice and save at the side once ready.
2. Chop peppers into bite size strips or pieces.
3. Cut 2 Chicken breasts into bite size pieces. 
4. Put peppers and chicken into a pan over medium heat until the chicken is properly cooked through.
5. Once chicken is cooked through add rice to pan and stir for around 5 minutes.
6. Add soy sauce and stir on a low heat 
7. Enjoy !  
8. This meal can also be split into 2 separate meals and enjoyed later on, just make sure to refrigerate before heating!

name: Chicken Egg fried Rice
description:
1. Boil 300G of rice and save at the side once ready.
2. Chop peppers into bite size strips or pieces.
3. Cut 2 Chicken breasts into bite size pieces. 
4. Put the peppers and chicken breasts in a pan on a medium heat till the chicken is cooked through.
5. Add rice and stir till fully mixed.
6. Create some space on the pan, crack 2 eggs and add.
7. Stir the eggs around the rice, chicken and peppers till fully cooked and mixed in.
8. Once fully mixed in add the soy sauce of your choosing around the dish and continue to stir on a low heat, till fully mixed in.
9. Enjoy

name: Longos chicken
description: Add paprika to chicken and fry in a pan with olive oil

name: Banana & Porridge Breakfast
description:
1. Slice Banana
2. Pour Porridge into the Bowl
3. Add Milk
4. Microwave for 2m
5. Add sliced banana to the heated porridge

name: Banana & Porridge Breakfast
description:
1. Slice 1x banana
2. Pour your oats into a large boal
3. Add milk of your choice
4. Place in the microwave for 2-3 minutes
5. Add your sliced banana

Voila!

name: Banana & Porridge Breakfast
description:
1. Slice your banana
2. Add oats to a large bowl
3. Add milk to your oats
4. Microwave for 2-3 mins
5. Add your banana to your porridge

Voila!

name: Poached Eggs
description:
1. Add a splash of white wine vinegar to a saucepan and some water. 
2. Bring to a simmer and slowly add the eggs to the water. 
3. Leave to cook for 4 minutes then toast the butter. 
4. Butter the toast and remove the eggs from the water using a slotted spoon and carefully place on the toast.

name: Scrambled Eggs
description:
1. Beat 2 eggs together with a splash of milk. 
2. Toast two slices of bread
3. While the toast is toasting pour the egg mix into a pan over a medium heat. 
4. Keep the eggs moving until they become firm and scrambled. 
5. Butter the toast and put the egg on top.

name: Crepes
description:
1. Sift 140g of flour into a bowl and make a well in the middle.
2. Mix 200ml of milk with 100ml of water and mix together. 
3. Break 2 eggs into the well and start mixing whilst slowly adding the milk. 
4. Whisk the batter until smooth. 
5. Place a frying pan over a high heat and add some oil. 
6. Pour in some batter and spread around the pan. 
7. Once the pancakes start to bubble flip them and cook the other side until both sides are golden. 
8. Enjoy with your choice of toppings.

name: American Pancakes
description:
1. Mix 200g self-raising flour, 1 Â½ tsp baking powder, 1 tbsp golden caster sugar and a pinch of salt together in a large bowl.
2. Create a well in the centre with the back of your spoon then add 3 large eggs, 25g melted butter and 200ml milk.
3. Whisk together until smooth then pour into a jug.
4. Heat a small knob of butter and 1 tsp of oil in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. When the butter looks frothy, pour in rounds of the batter, approximately 8cm wide. Make sure you donât put the pancakes too close together as they will spread during cooking. 
5. Cook the pancakes on one side for about 1-2 mins or until lots of tiny bubbles start to appear and pop on the surface. Flip the pancakes over and cook for a further minute on the other side. Repeat until all the batter is used up.
6. Serve your pancakes stacked up on a plate with a drizzle of maple syrup and any of your favourite toppings.

name: Waffles
description:
1. Heat the waffle maker according to manufacturer's instructions. 
2. Whisk 4 egg whites to stiff peaks. In a separate large bowl, mix together 300g flour, 1/2 tsp bicarbonate, 2 tbsp caster sugar and a pinch of salt.
3. Make a well in the centre and add the egg yolks and 50g melted butter. Start mixing with a balloon whisk; keep whisking as you slowly add the milk until you get a smooth, thick batter. Carefully fold in the egg whites with a metal spoon.
4. Use a ladle to pour the batter into your waffle maker and cook for 5 mins or according to the manufacturer's instructions. Repeat until all the batter has been used up. 
5. Serve with sweet or savoury toppings.

name: Cheesy Leaks
description:
1. Cut an avocado in half and carefully remove its stone, then scoop out the flesh into a bowl. 
2. Squeeze in some lemon juice then mash with a fork. 
3. Season to taste with sea salt, black pepper and chilli flakes. 
4. Toast your bread, drizzle over the oil then pile the avocado on top.

name: Smoked salmon and eggs on toast
description:
1. Toast the bread then butter once toasted. 
2. Place the salmon on top of the toast. 
3. Pour some white wine vinegar in a saucepan then add some water. 
4. Put over a medium heat then slowly drop in the eggs. 
5. Leave to cook for 4 minutes then carefully remove with a slotted spoon and place on top of the salmon.

name: Rhubarb compote
description:
1. Chop up the rhubarb and place on a baking tray. 
2. Sprinkle with sugar and pour over some lemon juice. 
3. Cook for 30 minutes until the rhubarb is soft. 
4. Can be served with yoghurt and granola and kept in the fridge for over a week.

name: Granola
description:
1. Mix together 200g of oats with your choice of nuts and fruit. 
2. Pour in 50g of honey and mix. 
3. Place on a baking tray then bake for 10 minutes. 
4. Can be serve with yoghurt or fruit compote.

name: Spinach and tomato omlette
description:
1. Whisk together 3 eggs with a splash of milk. 
2. Add a handful of spinach and a tomato cut up. 
3. Mix together then pour into a frying pan over a medium heat. 
4. If the top isn't fully cooking add a lid or put under a grill.

name: Ham and Cheese Omelette
description:
1. Whisk together 3 eggs with a handful of grated cheese, a splash of milk and a handful of chopped up ham. 
2. Pour the egg mix into a frying pan and put over a medium heat. 
3. Cook until firm, put a lid on the saucepan if the top isn't cooking or put under a grill.

name: Vegetable omelette
description:
1. Chop up a selection of vegetables of your choice, such as spinach, tomatoes, peppers and onion. 
2. Whisk together 3 eggs with the vegetables. 
3. Mix in a handful of grated cheese. 
4. Pour into a frying pan and place over a medium heat  
5. Leave to firm, if the top isn't cooking place a lid on the pan or place under the grill.

name: Breakfast bagel
description:
1. Cut a bagel in half and toast the halves. 
2. Fry an egg to your liking. 
3. Cook the bacon and sausages in a pan until crisp. 
4. Pile into the bagel.

name: Salmon and cream cheese bagel
description:
1. Slice the bagel in half and top with Philadelphia. 
2. Top the Philadelphia with smoked salmon and enjoy.

name: Halloumi and bacon hash
description:
1. Cut up the potatoes and lightly boil them in a saucepan. 
2. Once par boiled drain them. 
3. Chop up the tomatoes, halloumi and mushrooms and mix with the potatoes. 
4. Fry in a pan with a little oil. 
5. Fry an egg in a separate pan then top the hash mix with the egg.

name: French Toast
description:
1. Whisk together 2 eggs, 80ml of milk, 1 tsp of cinnamon and 40ml of cream. 
2. Dip the bread into the egg mix until its soaked. 
3. Fry the bread in a pan until golden. 
4. Serve with syrup and toppings of your choice.

name: Breakfast rice
description:
1. Add 200g of rice to a pan with 600ml of water, 200ml of milk and 1 tsp of cinnamon. 
2. Bring to the boil then cover and simmer for 30 minutes. 
3. Remove from the heat and serve with dried fruit.

name: Scrambled egg and bacon on toast
description:
1. Toast the bread then butter once toasted. 
2. Whisk 2 eggs with a splash of milk then pour into a pan, keep moving until it firms. 
3. Fry the bacon until it is crisp. 
4. Add the bacon then the egg onto the bread.

name: Cheesy crumpets
description:
1. Beat 3 eggs and 50ml of milk together then dip the crumpets in it. 
2. Heat a frying pan then fry the crumpets. 
3. Top with the grated cheese and fry until melted. 
4. Serve with tomatoes and avocado.

name: Eggs and black bean
description:
1. Break some eggs into a frying pan with some oil. 
2. Add some cooked beans with the juices to the pan once the eggs start to cook. 
3. Add the tomatoes to the pan and season. 
4. Remove from the heat and add sliced avocado.

name: Hash browns
description:
1. Grate the potatoes and onion, this is easiest with a food processor grater attachment. 
2. Squash between some kitchen roll to remove the liquid. 
3. Season the potato and onion mix. 
4. Squash together a handful and add to a frying pan with oil over a high heat. 
5. Fry for a few minutes then flip, cook until both sides are golden.

name: Chocolate porridge
description:
1. Mix 125g of porridge with 500ml of milk and add 1 tbsp of cocoa powder. 
2. Cook over a medium heat until the porridge thickens  
3. Serve topped with dried fruit of your choice.

name: Vegan porridge
description:
1. Mix 125g of oats with 500ml of oat milk. 
2. Cook over a medium heat until thickened. 
3. Top with blueberries or fruit of your choice.

name: Cinnamon & Cocoa Oatmeal
description:
1. Take a small-sized bowl
2. Pour a cup of oat flakes in the bowl
3. Add milk until the oats are fully covered with it
4. Add 1 tbsp of cocoa
5. Add 2 tbsp of cinnamon
6. Stir until the cocoa and cinnamon mix well with the milk
7. Microwave for 1min
8. Chop a banana and add it to the bowl, stir
9. Enjoy!

name: Halloumi eggy crumpets
description:
1. Cook the crumpets in a toaster. 
2. Poached the egg in some simmer water for 4 minutes. 
3. Slice the halloumi and tomatoes and fry in a pan until the halloumi is golden and the tomatoes are soft. 
4. Top the crumpets with the halloumi and egg and put the tomatoes on the side.

name: Eggs and Soldiers
description:
1. Place 2 eggs into boiling water and cook for 5 minutes. 
2. Toast slices of bread then butter once toasted and cut width ways into solider fingers. 
3. Remove the egg from the water and run under cold water to stop them cooking. 
4. Remove the top of the egg and dip the soldiers in the runny egg to enjoy.

name: Blueberry pancakes
description:
1. Mix together 200g of flour with 1tsp of baking powder and a pinch of salt. 
2. Beat one egg with 300ml of milk then whisk in the flour until smooth. 
3. Beat in a knob of melted butter, and gently stir in half of the 150g pack of blueberries.
4. Heat a teaspoon of sunflower oil or small knob of butter in a large non-stick frying pan.
5. Drop a large tablespoonful of the batter per pancake into the pan to make pancakes about 7.5cm across. Make three or four pancakes at a time.
6. Cook for about 3 minutes over a medium heat until small bubbles appear on the surface of each pancake, then turn and cook another 2-3 minutes until golden.
7. Serve with blueberries and syrup.

name: Beans on toast
description:
1. Heat half the can of beans in a microwave bowl for 5 minutes in the microwave. 
2. Toast two slices of bread then butter. 
3. Pour the beans over the bread. 
4. Top with cheese if you desire or a vegan alternative.

name: Banana split
description:
1. Cut the bananas down the middle length ways and arrange on the plate. 
2. Top with some yoghurt. 
3. Top with berries and honey.

name: Steak and eggs
description:
1. Slice the steak up and marinade it in a mix of olive oil, lime juice and chillis. 
2. Fry some eggs to your preferred fried style. 
3. Fry the steak for 2 minutes to make it medium rare or longer if you desire. 
4. Serve with the eggs and some hash browns if you like.

name: Chocolate chip pancakes
description:
1. In a bowl mix 300g of flour with 1tsp of baking powder and 3 tbsp of caster sugar. 
2. Whisk together 2 eggs with 300ml of milk. 
3. Combine the egg mix with the flour until the batter is smooth. 
4. Whisk in 150g of chocolate chips. 
5. Heat a small knob of butter in a large non-stick frying pan over a medium heat, swirling it round to coat the pan. Add 2-3 tbsp of the batter to the pan and cook for 1-2 mins, or until bubbles begin to rise to the surface.
6. Flip the pancake over and cook for 2 mins on the other side for the same amount of time, or until golden brown and puffed up. Repeat with the remaining batter, keeping the pancakes warm in a low oven.

name: Apple and blueberry danish
description:
1. Roll out the pastry and cut out 8x8cm squares. 
2. Mix the cut up apple and blueberries in a bowl with some sugar and lemon juice. 
3. Place in the middle of the pastry then fold up the edges. 
4. Place on a tray and bake in the oven for 20 minutes.
